alert.note: Alert for Davidson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 5:25PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Davidson County through 600 PM CDT... At 524 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Whites Creek, or 5 miles north of Nashville. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Madison, Goodlettsville, Joelton, Whites Creek and Beaman Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 85 and 95. Interstate 24 between mile markers 33 and 48. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
